newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila businesses remain bullish on Philippines.
newsitem.headline: Manila businesses remain bullish on Philippines.

text.p: The Philippines' Makati Business Club (MBC) said on Thursday that local businessmen were expecting a 7.0 to 7.5 percent growth in the country's gross national product (GNP) next year.
MBC executive director Guillermo Luz told reporters businessmen were expecting the industrial and services sectors to lead the growth.
MBC is a group of chief executives of the country's top business corporations.
The economy grew by 7.1 percent in the first nine months of the year, up from 5.3 percent growth in the same period last year. Full-year GNP growth is projected at 6.5 to 7.5 percent.
Luz said businessmen were expecting stable inflation and foreign exchange rates next year.
Inflation is expected to slide to 6.0 to 6.5 percent next year from around 7.5 percent this year.
